pr_title: make all OpenGrok cookies use the SameSite attribute

timeline.message: add PageConfig.addCookie() to set cookies with common set of attributes

timeline.bodyText: Even though I did not see repeating headers in the response maybe this should just record the cookie in a map and the actual headers will be added in a filter.
timeline.author: vladak

replies.bodyText: found a solution to this in https://stackoverflow.com/a/51576089/11582827
replies.author: vladak

timeline.message:
Revert "add PageConfig.addCookie() to set cookies with common set of attributes"

This reverts commit 977a9d1587d23da06ee876ebba6f7dc1dd3cf049.

use the filter after all

fixes #3164

use the filter after all

fixes #3164

timeline.author: ahornace

timeline.bodyText: Is this necessary? It indicates that the whole filter will be taken out of service (I assume garbage collected) so this is not needed, right?
timeline.author: ahornace

replies.bodyText:
It probably needs to be overridden but empty:
[ERROR] /home/travis/build/oracle/opengrok/opengrok-web/src/main/java/org/opengrok/web/CookieFilter.java:[40,8] org.opengrok.web.CookieFilter is not abstract and does not override abstract method destroy() in javax.servlet.Filter
replies.author: ahornace

timeline.author: ahornace
ahornace

replies.bodyText: The first argument of spliteratorUnknownSize has to be either primitive number type or Iterator which is not available in JDK 8. Also, this sort of conversion to stream seems, uh, unnatural.
replies.author: vladak

replies.bodyText:
Yes, however, there are helper methods for this in Guava and maybe apache-commons -> if we have one of them on the classpath then we could leverage that. If not, then creating a simple toStream util method would make this nicer.
But you are right, https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/util/Enumeration.html#asIterator() is available since JDK9
replies.author: ahornace

timeline.message:
